Howard is not in such a great area, so there is constant alerts to make us aware of what is going on ion the area. They want us to be safe so we have security guard in every dorm to make sure that each person lives in that dorm. And if something were to happen to you, there are areas where it has place that if you push the button it contacts the police.

Our Greek Life at Howard is amazing because many of the black fraternities and sororities started there. If you want to get involved with the Greek Life, you have to be connected because it is very secretive and you start pledging your Sophomore year.
They have all state clubs, Freshman Leadership Academy, and many other clubs to name that you can get involved in.
Its great for all students especially who like to party but who can stay focused at the same time.

Our Homecoming is the best thing at howard because there is always something to do during that time. For one, We have a parade down Georgia Avenue, Yardfest, a fashion show, a concert, a panel discussion to help build your brand, and Gospel show.
Howard is definitely bang for you buck because it has so much to offer the students not only an education but a network of people.

At Howard, there is always a party, so you will find out about them on campus or at your dorm. If you want to go shopping, you can take the G2 to Georgetown and it has a movie theatre, restaurants, and a lot of shops.

The food was basic dorm food, but on Thursdays, it would be soul food Thursday, which is usually the best day for food at Howard. Also there is place called the Punchout in Blackburn, which has other places to eat if you don't necessarily want the food in the cafeteria.
I loved my dorm because it's no like the other dorms at Howard because it has bigger rooms and a cafeteria, so you wouldn't have to travel all the way to Blackburn.
For me, my freshman year went very well but that is not the case with me other students. also I know as I go on at Howard it will get harder and harder because of the major I have chosen.

At Howard, there are many distractions such as parties, boys/girls, and drugs/ alcohol, and it gets real easy to get caught up. Don't let those distractions get in your way remain focused because you went to Howard for a reason, which is to receive a higher education.

Howard University is one of the top HBCUs for any African American to attend. It has the best School of Business and offers so many opportunities to their students than many other colleges. Going to Howard is world of difference than attending normal college.

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot Since I'm in the School of Business the curriculum proved to be challenging. I took 15 credit hours for my first semester freshman year and I could handle it. There are hundreds of classes to take and what's better is that you can choose what classes you want and which teacher which is a choice that I didn't have in high school. I've learned the most in my Business Orientation class about credit and how to invest money at an earlier age. During the first semester, the School of B students are put into teams where we are given different projects and presentations that we have to present to the class. These groups helped me learn how to work with others and how to formulate certain business ideas and how to market new products. Now that my first semester is over, I'm excited to see how much Howard will teach me in the coming years.
